hanzi-su-wiki:
織

Значения

Ткать, вязать; сплетать, соединять

Мнемоника

Структура — хорошо различимый 戠 порядок расположения нитей 糸 готовой ткани.

Варианты

织

heisig_chinese_memo: Spidey is late for the kazoo fiesta so he weaves in and out of buildings trying to sling his way there ASAP.&nbsp
heisig_constituent: weave, thread, spiderman, kazoo, sound, vase, stand up, sun, day, fiesta
koohiiStory1: Spiderman weaves his way through the skyline while listening to his theme song on his ipod. It is played, of course, by kazoos.
koohiiStory2: Play the kazoo magically and the thread will weave itself.

組織(そしき): organization, structure, construction, tissue, system
jp_readingExamples: 織機 (しょっき), 染織 (せんしょく), 紡織 (ぼうしょく), 織る (お.る)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Taking a thread and moving to the sound of the music, a drunkard makes a weave through some fabric. He’s using the thread to weave his clothes back together after he damaged them in a fall down the stairs. You know, because he’s a drunkard.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine this drunkard bipping and bopping to the sound of the music as he weaves this thread through his clothes to repair them.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: This drunkard is actually a Sheikh (しき) (an Arabic leader), but he’s just fallen on hard times and has been hitting the bottle pretty hard lately. The piece of clothing he is using the thread to weave back together is one of his fancy formal robes.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine this drunken Sheikh again, only this time he is moving to the sound of some Arabic music. You know what that sounds like, right?
Ru_Notes: Фонетик: 戠 (ショク、シキ、シ собирать, склеивать). Не путать: 職 (ショク、ソク должность, работа), 職 (ショク、ソク должность, работа).
Ru_Radicals: 小 (маленький), 幺 (короткая нить), 戈 (копьё), 日 (день), 立 (стоять), 糸 (нить), 音 (звук)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you mix your thread (糸) with potter's clay (戠) to weave it
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Thread is not the only thing you can use to weave.  How about some yarn?
humanum_full_description_en:
Inscriptions from "糸", " 𢦏 " sound, the original meaning is to make cloth. E Jun Qizhou Festival: "Weaving Yin", "Weaving Yin" is the chief in charge of sewing and embroidering brocade (see Shengwu). "Shuowen": "Weaving is the name of cloth and silk. From the sound of Shido." "Poetry‧Daya‧Zhanmao": "Women have no official business, stop silkworm weaving."

" Weaving " can generally refer to weaving. "The Sixth Policy of the Warring States Period": "The general is in Jimo, sitting and weaving, standing and standing."

" Weaving " also means silk fabrics made from dyed silk. "Book of Rites‧ Yuzao": "The scholar does not weave clothes." Zheng Xuan's note: "Weaving, dyeing silk and weaving, also dyeing the clothes of scholars."

" Weaving " is also a metaphor for the entanglement of objective things. Tang Libai "Bodhisattva Man": "Pinglin, desert, smoke, weaving, sadness in the cold mountains."

" Weaving " also means collecting. "Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 16: "What do you want? By the way, weave and honor."
humanum_short_description_en: Inscriptions from "糸", " 𢦏 " sound, the original meaning is to make cloth.
humanum_full_description:
金文從「糸」，「𢦏」聲，本義為製作布帛。鄂君啟舟節：「織尹」，「織尹」是主管縫織綉錦的長官（參于省吾）。《說文》：「織，作布帛之緫名也。从糸戠聲。」《詩‧大雅‧瞻卬》：「婦無公事，休其蠶織。」

　　「織」可泛指編織。《戰國策‧齊策六》：「將軍之在即墨，坐而織蕢，立則丈插。」

　　「織」也表示用染絲織成的絲織品。《禮記‧玉藻》：「士不衣織。」鄭玄注：「織，染絲織之，士衣染繒也。」

　　「織」也比喻客觀事物紛繁交錯。唐李白〈菩薩蠻〉：「平林漠漠煙如織，寒山一帶傷心碧。」

　　「織」還表示搜羅。《紅樓夢》第16回：「要什麼東西？順便織來孝敬。」
humanum_short_description: 金文從「糸」，「𢦏」聲，本義為製作布帛。

金文從「 糸 」，「 𢦏 」聲，本義為製作布帛。鄂君啟舟節：「織尹」，「織尹」是主管縫織綉錦的長官（參于省吾）。《說文》：「織，作布帛之緫名也。从糸戠聲。」《詩‧大雅‧瞻卬》：「婦無公事，休其蠶織。」 「 織 」可泛指編織。《戰國策‧齊策六》：「將軍之在即墨，坐而織蕢，立則丈插。」 「 織 」也表示用染絲織成的絲織品。《禮記‧玉藻》：「士不衣織。」鄭玄注：「織，染絲織之，士衣染繒也。」 「 織 」也比喻客觀事物紛繁交錯。唐李白〈菩薩蠻〉：「平林漠漠煙如織，寒山一帶傷心碧。」 「 織 」還表示搜羅。《紅樓夢》第16回：「要什麼東西？順便織來孝敬。」
Inscriptions from " 糸", " 𢦏" sound, the original meaning is to make cloth. E Jun Qizhou Festival: "Weaving Yin", "Weaving Yin" is the chief in charge of sewing and embroidering brocade (see Shengwu). "Shuowen": "Weaving is the name of cloth and silk. From the sound of Shido." "Poetry‧Daya‧Zhanmao": "Women have no official business, stop silkworm weaving." " Weaving" can generally refer to weaving. "The Sixth Policy of the Warring States Period": "The general is in Jimo, sitting and weaving, standing and standing." " Weaving" also means silk fabrics made from dyed silk. "Book of Rites‧ Yuzao": "The scholar does not weave clothes." Zheng Xuan's note: "Weaving, dyeing silk and weaving, also dyeing the clothes of scholars." " Weaving" is also a metaphor for the entanglement of objective things. Tang Libai "Bodhisattva Man": "Pinglin, desert, smoke, weaving, sadness in the cold mountains." " Weaving" also means collecting. "Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 16: "What do you want? By the way, weave and honor."

織字的基本解释

織
zhī

織
zhì
均见“织”。

織字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhī］
［《廣韻》之翼切，平職，章。］
“綕1”的今字。“织1”的繁体字。
(1)制作布帛之总称。
(2)编织。
(3)搜罗。
(4)比喻客观事物纷繁交错。
(5)比喻思想情绪纷乱纠结。
[②]［zhì］
［《廣韻》職吏切，去志，章。］
“綕2”的今字。“织2”的繁体字。
(1)用染丝织成的丝织品。
(2)通“幟”。旗帜；标志。

織字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【糸字部】　織； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页938第29
〔古文〕?綕??【廣韻】之翼切【集韻】【韻會】質力切，?音職。【說文】作布帛之總名。【小爾雅】治絲曰織。織，繒也。【廣韻】組織。【書·禹貢】厥篚織文。【傳】織文，錦綺之屬。　又【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】?職利切，音志。【正韻】支義切，音寘。【禮·玉藻】士不衣織。【註】織，染絲織之，士衣染繒也。　又【集韻】昌志切，音熾。幟或作織。【詩·小雅】織文鳥章。【箋】織，幑也。【疏】幟與織，字雖異，音實同也。【前漢·食貨志】旗織加其上。【註】師古曰：織，讀曰幟。　【類篇】或作?。

織字的源字形

字源演变：

甲骨文小篆楷体

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zhī］
[The Wing Cut of "Guang Yun", Ping Shi, Chapter. ]
The present character of "綕1". Traditional Chinese characters for "織1".
(1) The general term for making cloth.
(2) Weaving.
(3) Collecting.
(4) Metaphorical objects are numerous and intertwined.
(5) Metaphorical thoughts and emotions are chaotic and tangled.
[②]［zhì］
["Guangyun" staff cut, go to record, chapter. ]
The present character of "綕2". "Weave 2" in traditional characters.
(1) Silk fabrics woven with dyed silk.
(2) Pass "Zhang". Flags; flags.
Weave
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Not concentrated] [Shizi Department] 　Weaving; Kangxi Strokes: 18; Page Number: Page 938 29
〔古文〕 綕?? [Guang Yun] Wing Cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] Quality and strength, good sound job. [Said the text] as the general name of cloth and silk. [Xiao Erya] The treatment of silk is called weaving. Weaving, 缯 also. [Guang Yun] Organization. 【Book·Yugong】Jezhu weaving texts. [Biography] Weaving text, belonging to Jinqi.　[Guang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting]? Job Liqie, audio record. [Zheng Yun] The meaning is cut, and the sound is placed. 【Rite·Yuzao】Seniors don’t wear clothes. [Note] Weaving, dyeing silk weaving, and dyeing cloth for Shiyi.　[Jiyun] Chang Zhiqie, Yin Chi. Flag or weaving. 【Poetry·Xiaoya】Weaving a bird chapter. [Jan] Weaving, yeah. [Sparse] Flag and weaving, although the characters are different, the sound is the same. [Previous Han·Shihuo Zhi] The flag weave adds to it. [Note] Shigu said: weaving, reading the flag.　【Classification】Or as?.

zhī
вм. 织
Radicals: 糸, 音, 戈  (thread, sound, drunkard)
Meaning Mnemonic
Taking a thread and moving to the sound of the music, a drunkard makes a weave through some fabric. He’s using the thread to weave his clothes back together after he damaged them in a fall down the stairs. You know, because he’s a drunkard.
Imagine this drunkard bipping and bopping to the sound of the music as he weaves this thread through his clothes to repair them.
Reading Mnemonic
This drunkard is actually a Sheikh (しき) (an Arabic leader), but he’s just fallen on hard times and has been hitting the bottle pretty hard lately. The piece of clothing he is using the thread to weave back together is one of his fancy formal robes.
Imagine this drunken Sheikh again, only this time he is moving to the sound of some Arabic music. You know what that sounds like, right?
